intro: Lophozonia alpina, commonly known as the alpine lophozonia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Lophozonia alpina is often found in meadows and slopes at high altitudes, contributing to the biodiversity of mountain ecosystems. Its structure and growth patterns reflect its adaptation to harsh, high-altitude environments.
